intro: Hieracium trichoglossum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, thriving in temperate climates. It features yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium trichoglossum is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
